::: {.cell}

:::



## Purpose

Importing data is the first step in the workflow. 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("NHANES")
install.packages("devtools")
```
:::



## First Setup the library:


::: {.cell autorun='false' completion='true'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(psych)
library(knitr)
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(scales)     # for number formatting like comma()
library(english)    # to convert numbers to words
library(stringr)    # for text functions like str_c()
library(NHANES)
```
:::



# Datasets

You will learn how to import different datasets:

- datasets in R packages `NHANES` and `YRBS`

- class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11) collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course

- team dataset "oralhealth"

## File Formats

- National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey dataset from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) using the R package `NHANES`

- a `.csv` file format of the class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11)" collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course `03152025ProlificHealthBeliefs.csv`

- a `.xlsx` file format of the class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11) collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course `03152025ProlificHealthBeliefs.xlsx`

- a `.sav` file format from SPSS of the FRI team project on oral health `10312024oralhealth.sav`. 


::: {.cell autorun='false' completion='true'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load your data
select_data <- read.csv("data/03.15.2025.ProlificHealthBeliefs.csv")

# displays structures of R objects
str(select_data)
```
:::






::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Install required packages
install.packages("NHANES")
install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages("GGally")
install.packages("iris")

# Load the packages
library(NHANES)
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
```
:::


## Data Structure
Now, you will view the structure of the NHANES data

```{webr-r}
library(NHANES)
# Load the data and view its structure
str(NHANESraw)
```

## Data Header

```{webr-r}
library(NHANES)
# Load the data and view its header
head(NHANESraw)
```

## View Data

In Posit Cloud, you can use `View()` in your CONSOLE to view the dataframe.  

```{{r}}
library(NHANES)
# View data
View(NHANESraw)
```
